comments: Bug seems not to be present in AJDT 1.4 under Eclipse 3.2RC7.  Reduced severity to normal.
that error is occurring in the structure model building code.  Do you know what level of tools/compiler you were using when it happened? Just a dev build of AJDT 1.4?
It was AspectJ 1.5.2rc1 compiler running inside Eclipse 3.1.2.

Ok.  the only reason I can see that error occurring (and it may explain some of your other unusual errors...) is that your eclipse is running with an up-to-date compiler plugin but an old weaver plugin.  Can you check the dates of your plugins?  If you go to the eclipse plugins directory, you will probably have multiple versions installed, eclipse will be using the most recent when it runs (you can also confirm this in the UI with Help>AboutEclipseSDK and then clicking 'AJ').  On my system I have these, org.aspectj.ajde is the compiler whilst org.aspectj.weaver is the weaver:

C:\e32rc6\eclipse\plugins>dir *ajde*
 Directory of C:\e32rc6\eclipse\plugins

12/06/2006  09:01    <DIR>          org.aspectj.ajde_1.5.2.20060608070626
23/06/2006  08:46    <DIR>          org.aspectj.ajde_1.5.2.20060622114659


C:\e32rc6\eclipse\plugins>dir *weaver*
 Directory of C:\e32rc6\eclipse\plugins

12/06/2006  09:01    <DIR>          org.aspectj.weaver_1.5.2.20060608070626
23/06/2006  08:46    <DIR>          org.aspectj.weaver_1.5.2.20060622114659

the most recent of both have the same date/time stamp: 20060622114659.  Is that the same with your setup?

Going from memory, since I already wiped out my Eclipse 3.1.2 install... I had ajde and weaver 1.5.1, only one version present of each, and I overwrote the aspectjrt.jar and aspectjweaver.jar in each, respectively, with the jars from the newer 1.5.2rc1.  The problem was present both before and after I did this.

errr - so you replaced weaver but you didnt replace the compiler?  Manually patching AJDT in this way can get you into trouble.  If you are doing this, please mention it when you raise the bug :(

You also needed to replace the ajde.jar with a new version of compiler, thats why this is happening.  You have a new weaver but an old compiler.

I happen to know that if you currently install AJDT from the update site URL for 1.3.1, you will get the version containing AspectJ1.5.2rc1, there is no need to patch it yourself.

Since I am no longer able to reproduce this "bug" (having deleted that install of Eclipse), I'm closing this bug report as invalid.  I'll let someone else open a new one if they manage to stumble across it again.  Thanks for taking the time to look into it.

(just want to qualify what I said about AJDT downloads:  although the aj version on the download page for ajdt1.3.1 for eclipse says 1.5.1a, we have built and are testing it with 1.5.2 inside.  Currently at the update site is AJDT 1.3.1 containing 1.5.2rc1 and shortly (when the eclipse server mirrors are reactivated) it will be AJDT 1.3.1 including 1.5.2 final.)
